vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/9ad4b624-6218-4f7e-978d-a7e675d0b8e2">WELSH ASSEMBLY GOVERNMENT</keyword>         <topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>National Survey for Wales</i> (NSW) is a major study conducted by the Welsh Government. The NSW is one of the main ways in which the Welsh Government knows what issues are important to the people of Wales. A pilot study was completed in 2009-2010 and main stage fieldwork on the survey started in January 2012. The NSW will run continuously to at least 2015. TNS-BRMB and Beaufort Research Ltd have commissioned by the Welsh Government to carry out the survey fieldwork.  The final dataset is based on a representative sample across Wales, ensuring balanced sampling across each local authority.  The survey involves conducting more than 14,000 25-minute face-to-face interviews with a randomly selected representative sample of people aged 16 and over across Wales per year (approximately 660 interviews in each local authority). Fieldwork is based on a random probability sample design and is conducted on a continuous basis. The information collected will be used to inform the development of policy and the delivery of public services.<br> <br> The NSW has replaced the <i>Living in Wales</i> survey series (available from the UK Data Archive under GN 33397). Further information is available on the Welsh Government <a href="http://wales.gov.uk/about/aboutresearch/social/ocsropage/nationalsurveyforwales/?lang=en" title ="National Survey for Wales">National Survey for Wales</a> web pages.<br> </abstract>       <abstract>The <i> National Survey for Wales, 2012-2013</i> is the first year of this major study of adults across Wales. Although the main reporting year for the survey runs in line with financial years (April to the following March), an initial three months of fieldwork was carried out in January to March 2012: 'Quarter 0'. The purpose of this period was to provide national-level results from the survey as quickly as possible, as well as to ensure that the survey was running smoothly before the start of the first reporting year. Therefore a Quarter 0 data file and a Year 1 data file are available from the UK Data Archive.<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The survey covers a wide range of topics to allow links to be made between different policy areas. There is a particular focus on well-being and people's views of public services. <br> <br> The 2012-2013 topics were:<ul><li>overall satisfaction with the transport, health and education systems and the Welsh Government</li><li>access to and satisfaction with GP and hospital services</li><li>schools and parental engagement</li><li>local authority services</li><li>well-being, including quality of the local area, feeling safe and personal finances</li><li>internet access and use</li><li>smoke alarms</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="2012-01-01T00:00:00Z">January 2012</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="2013-03-01T00:00:00Z">March 2013</timePrd>         <collDate>Quarter 0: January \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd March 2012; Year 1: April 2012 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd March 2013</collDate>         <nation>Wales</nation>         <geogUnit>Unitary Authorities (Wales)</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Westminster Parliamentary Constituencies</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Welsh National Assembly Electoral Regions</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Local Health Boards</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Postcode (Area)</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Police Force Areas</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Fire and Rescue Service Regions</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Public Services Footprint Areas</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Individuals aged 16 or over living in private households in Wales, 2012-2013.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>TNS BMRB</dataCollector>         <dataCollector>Beaufort Research Limited</dataCollector>         <sampProc>One-stage stratified or systematic random sample</sampProc>         <sampProc>See documentation for details</sampProc>         <deviat>Quarter 0: 3,558 cases; Year 1: 14,552 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Self-completion</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.
